meanings.definition: The quality or state of being objective.
meanings.sent1: Her objectivities in the debate impressed everyone with her fair judgment.
meanings.sent2: It is important to maintain objectivities when conducting scientific experiments.
meanings.sent3: His extreme objectivities sometimes made him seem like a robot!
meanings.sent4: The objectivities of the situation were crystal clear to everyone involved.
meanings.sent5: The objectivities of the case were so evident that no one could argue against them.

meanings.definition: The act of considering or treating something as an object.
meanings.sent1: The objectivities of the artist's work were evident in every brushstroke.
meanings.sent2: In art class, we learned about the importance of objectivities in still life drawing.
meanings.sent3: His objectivities towards his car made it seem like his prized possession.
meanings.sent4: She approached the problem with the objectivities of a scientist dissecting a specimen.
meanings.sent5: The objectivities of the sculpture made it stand out among the other pieces in the gallery.

meanings.definition: The state of existing independently of the mind.
meanings.sent1: The objectivities of the physical world are not influenced by our thoughts.
meanings.sent2: Philosophers often debate the concept of objectivities in relation to reality.
meanings.sent3: The objectivities of the universe are beyond our complete understanding.
meanings.sent4: The objectivities of nature continue to amaze scientists with their complexity.
meanings.sent5: The objectivities of the cosmos are a source of wonder for many stargazers.
